user.title: Find your Station
user.description:
Please enter the name of your station (e.g. 'Berlin Hbf').

If your station is not found in the official IRIS list, don't worry! You can use the 'Manual Entry' option in the next step to add it anyway.

choose.title: Select Station
choose.description:
We found multiple matches. Please select your station from the list below.

If your station is not listed, or you want to use a specific local transport provider (e.g. MVV, VRN), select the **Manual Entry** option.

details.title: Configure Sensor
details.description:
Setup options for **{station}**.

**Data Source**: By default, we use the Deutsche Bahn (Info) system. If this is a local transport station (Bus, Tram, Subway) that DB doesn't know about, please enable **Show Advanced Options** and select the correct Data Source (e.g. MVV, VRN) in the next step.

data.next_departures: Number of Upcoming Departures to show
data.advanced: Show Advanced Options (Change Data Source / Filter Settings)

advanced.title: Advanced Configuration
advanced.description:
Here you can fine-tune the sensor for **{station}**.

**Crucial for Non-DB Stations**: Change the 'Data Source' to your local provider if no data appears with the default setting.

data.drop_late_trains: Remove trains that are already gone
data.past_60_minutes: Include departures from the last 60 minutes
data.keep_endstation: Keep departure even if this is the end station
data.via_stations_logic: Via Station Search Logic (AND = all must match, OR = at least one)
data.favorite_trains: Multiple Favorite Trains (comma separated e.g. 'ICE 1, RE 2')

manual_config.title: Configure Custom Station
manual_config.description:
Setting up **{station}**.

⚠️ **Important**: Since this station was not found in the IRIS database, you **must select the correct Data Source** below. For example, select 'MVV' for Munich local transport or 'VRN' for Rhein-Neckar.

error.no_stations_found: No matching stations found. You can try a different search term or use Manual Entry.
error.cannot_connect: Could not connect to the server. Please check your internet connection.
error.station_not_found_warning: ⚠️ Station name not found in the IRIS results. Please double-check spelling.
error.station_invalid: ❌ Could not retrieve data for this station. {error_detail}
error.station_validation_failed: Station validation failed. Please check your settings and try again.

abort.station_validation_failed: Could not validate the station. No departure data could be retrieved. Please check the station name and data source.

general_options.title: General Settings
general_options.description: Configure basic update and query settings.

filter_options.title: Filter Settings
filter_options.description: Filter departures by direction, platform, or train type.

data.favorite_trains: Multiple Favorite Trains (comma separated e.g. 'ICE 1, RE 2')

display_options.title: Display Settings
display_options.description: Configure how the data is displayed.

advanced_options.title: Advanced Settings
advanced_options.description: Advanced configuration for API and data handling.

init.title: Stale Data for {station}
init.description:
The departure data for **{station}** has not been updated for **{hours} hours**.

This could be caused by:
- Temporary API issues
- The station may no longer be supported by the backend
- Network connectivity problems

What would you like to do?

init.title: API Error for {station}
init.description:
Multiple errors occurred while fetching data for **{station}**:

`{error}`

This might be a temporary issue. You can try again or change the data source.

change_source.title: Change Data Source
change_source.description: Select a different data source for this station.

station_unsupported.title: Station may no longer be supported

init.title: Station Possibly Unsupported
init.description:
The station **{station}** (using **{data_source}**) has failed to return data multiple times.

This station may no longer be supported by the backend. You can:
- Try again to check if it's a temporary issue
- Change to a different data source
- Remove this station from your configuration

[Report an issue on GitHub]({docs_url})

change_source.title: Change Data Source
change_source.description: Select a different data source for this station.

connection_error.title: Connection error
connection_error.description: Could not connect to the departure API for **{station}**. This issue will resolve automatically when the connection is restored.

watch_train.name: Watch Train
watch_train.description: Registers a background task to monitor a specific train departure from a station.

train_id.name: Train ID
train_id.description: The train number to watch (e.g., 'ICE 123'). Must match exactly what is shown in the sensor.

notify_service.name: Notify Service
notify_service.description: The notification service to call (e.g. 'mobile_app_my_phone'). Do not include the domain 'notify.', just the service name.

delay_threshold.name: Delay Threshold
delay_threshold.description: Minimum delay in minutes to trigger a notification (Default: 5).

notify_on_platform_change.name: Notify on Platform Change
notify_on_platform_change.description: Whether to notify if the platform changes.

notify_on_cancellation.name: Notify on Cancellation
notify_on_cancellation.description: Whether to notify if the train is cancelled.
